text: Bolivia competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Open water swimming== Bolivia qualified two male and one female open water swimmers. ;Men {|class=wikitable style="font- size:90%;" |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Rodrigo Caballero |align=left|Men's 5 km |54:08.0 |44 |-align=center |align=left|Men's 10 km |1:59:41.5 |62 |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Zedheir Torrez |align=left|Men's 5 km |1:00:36.2 |54 |-align=center |align=left|Men's 10 km |2:08:27.7 |70 |} ;Women {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%;" |- !Athlete !Event !Time !Rank |-align=center |align=left rowspan=2|Camila Mercado |align=left|Women's 5 km |1:11:17.4 |52 |-align=center |align=left|Women's 10 km |2:23:09.7 |62 |} ==Swimming== Bolivia has entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;
